page.title: 12THE PONTELAND BYPASS
page.content: For fifty years a{bypass}has been proposed for Ponteland.Improvements have been made but the conditions on the{A696}are highly unsatisfactory.The {Department of Transport}has considered two routes. The D.O.T. preferred the route that crossed Ponteland golf course,severing the club house from a major part of the course and would cut {Eland Hall}off from Ponteland on the south side.It would also be very close to the houses on Eland Green,The Green and Pont View.The route preferred by the local council (estimated to be 6% more expensive and slightly longer) would at least move the line of the road away from the formentioned properties.The outer route would still affect five holes on the golf course but clever landscaping on the D.O.T. route would avoid adverse effects in the area.
